Message.Title: Analysis :: World Economy
Message.Msg: "We must now conclude that the eight-quarter slowdown in China's economic growth is over and that a slight acceleration in growth is occurring. It is now unlikely that meaningful monetary easing moves will be needed or employed in China, though monetary policy remains friendly. This is a clear positive for U.S. equities, as we can now scratch off a Chinese hard landing as a concern because the accumulated data are convincing. Importantly, a modestly strengthening Chinese economy reduces the risk that global economic growth will hit a wall or stall speed." http://finance.yahoo.com/news/current-fears-overblown-110000936.html "The important point is that the decline in business activity in Europe, though demonstrating slightly below-zero growth, is no longer accelerating. It is not out of the question that the European economies are now undergoing a bottoming process. Indeed, small incremental economic growth could be possible in Europe by the last half of 2013. I have tried to respond to the hyperbole of the cliffs with hard-hitting analysis and solid logic of argument, which has led me to a contrarian view on the cliffs' impacts on the equity market. While I remain concerned about the prospects for U.S. corporate profits, one out of four cliffs ain't bad."

Message.Title: Cisco's results indicate that Q3 drop-off was mostly due to Windows 8 pushouts
Message.Msg: Since Cisco is considered a bell-weather stock due to its large global presence and they have come out with good results and decent forecasts, I suspect that the Q3 sales drop-off was mostly due to customers pushing out purchases for Windows 8. If so, we should see a bounce back in Q4 for Intel....even if it is a modest one due to the proliferation of tablets. The next leg up would be Haswell targeting tablets and convertible notebooks. Though most reports indicate Q2 2013 as the timeframe for likely introduction, there are some reports indicating that Intel is moving fast on the transition to Haswell. That should provide the catalyst for more rapid growth for Intel in 2013. Of course, the z2580 and z2000 should also improve Intel's position in the Smartphone space. 2013 is shaping up to be a comeback year for Intel if it manages to get all the products out on time.

with just one post... got you to chop off a year... and let's just chop off yet another year... back to 2012... how's INTC today... did you notice ARMH today keep the faith....

You guys are now reaching out to 2014 to compete with ARM.... DESPERATE !!!!! ____________________ this from a guy that pounds this board with ARM server info.......not due out until 2015. Is this guy a greaseball or what ??!!

With all the negative news out there about INTC, everything seems gloomy. But research a little and you come to realize that INTC is truly reacting to market changes. Haswell is INTC's answer to tablets. INTC will take a good chunk of tablet market when Haswell debuts in thin sexy PC convertibles running windows 8 UI with touch capabilities. Atom z2580 will be INTC's answer to smartphone market. The last year INTC has been perfecting performance and interoperability of Android on x86 platform. A z2580 phone will come out and will be thin, sexy and consume less power than other phones while being the most powerful. By 2014, INTC will have a major manufacturing advantage when they switch to 14nm and then Haswell (desktop core more powerful than core i7) will be in phones. That is the roadmap you should keep in mind of.

Message.Title: Communication is the fastest growing chip segment
Message.Msg: Everybody is blahblahing about death of PC but don't see the huge opportunity for Intel to build a foundry business going forward: Cisco’s Custom Silicon on the rise plus Cisco rumored to sign a mega Billion Dollar Foundry deal with Intel Corp. to collaborate and build powerful Next GenX Custom Silicon & Network Processors .... For example, Lenoski’s team, which designs chips for Cisco’s data center group, recently announced Monticello, a 40-nm chip that powers the company’s Nexus 3548 switch. The 412-mm2 chip packs 2.5 billion transistors delivering 48 ports of 10 Gbit/second Ethernet with 250-nanosecond latency in standard mode and as little as 50 nanoseconds in a dedicated mode. The latter is geared to Wall Street’s high-frequency traders and other speed demons.... Netronome is a network processor company from Santa Clara, California Intel’s home town, with whom Intel has been working for five years on development but onlt signed up for foundry services earlier this year. Under the agreement, Netronome also gets to use Intel’s own EDA tools.

Topic.Title: Have a feeling that Qualcom and Intel will end up in bed together

Message.Msg: well, att, there's something we can agree on.
I read Hawell as a 10w device, too much power hunger for smartphones. Hi end tablets, notebooks and up, but prolly not smartfones.
Wallis made this statement on Jan 24, 2012 and on May 2nd and May 3rd, 2012 it reached highs of 29.27 both days... pretty close to 30 I'd say...

' but many if not most smartphones want 1 - 4W power levels. How will Intel compete there?' single, dual and quad-core 22nm Silvermont core aka Merrifield SoC. Don't forget there is a 14nm shrink of Haswell in 2014 called Broadwell which should reduce power more. The Intel yearly refresh roadmap is like a Boa Constrictor wrapped around ARM/AMD etc, every year it will squeeze the pressure some more ;-).

I have known and discussed computer architecture/industry with David Kantor for years, all his articles are quality technical pieces and he is the best popular computer analyst after years of discussing computer architecture/industry with architects/serious users and Linus Torvalds on RWT made him so. Sometimes I don't always agree with his conclusions but it is often just a question of degree we differ in e.g. Haswell's improvement will be a lot more than 10% in applications that can make full use of the extra core functionality and compute power.
I am more amazed by an INTC investor bashing his own stock investment in favor of a stock he is not invested in, ARMH ! ;-) That must take some bizarre mental gymnastics to achieve I am sure lol.

Message.Title: My Jan 2015 Price Target -- $40
Message.Msg: Just so I have it on the record. Let the bashing begin... But, I bet the "melt up" on this will be epic. 70% of my LT calls now marked to the money. Waiting to mark the remaining 30% until after November OE... I appreciate the hard work all of you momentum traders have done in driving down my acquisition cost. I am grateful to have the chance to buy at these levels again. I know... I know... You will all say I've "lost" money. That's the difference between a trader and an investor. I accumulate as it drops below fair value basic upon well established time tested economic value capture principles and sell when it exceeds fair value based upon said principles. Keep shorting please. I'd love to get this down to $19 before I adjust the rest of my strikes...

ALERT! K8 Sledgehammer and K10 Barcelona outsell Trinity! By dontrustchinamen . Nov 14, 2012 5:08 PM . Permalink Shocking but true! Per Mercury Research for Q3 2012: AMD K8/K10 = 4224 Ms of units AMD Trinity = 4023 Ms of units 9 year old and 5 year old architectures are outselling AMD's latest and greatest APU, Trinity! From AMD board What is salvageable? AMD and NVDA fighting over stagnant market ... ashes,ashes all fall down

Topic.Title: Shove Wall Street Off the Fiscal Cliff

Message.Msg: Just keep ranting - you're clueless and you should sell your Intel stock tomorrow November 5, 2012 - The US semiconductor industry now employs almost a quarter of a million workers and added jobs three times faster than the rest of the US economy, according to an analysis of government data by the Semiconductor Industry Association (SIA). Total direct US semiconductor employment is estimated at 244,800. "Semiconductor workers -- a quarter of a million strong and growing -- are creating the technology breakthroughs that improve our lives, strengthen our country, and build our future," stated Brian Toohey, SIA president and CEO. "Through their hard work, the US semiconductor industry continues to create jobs and spur growth despite a challenging national economy." According to the US Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), the semiconductor industry's manufacturing workforce grew by 3.7% over the previous year, while jobs throughout the broader US economy increased by 1.2%. (It's worth mentioning that the nation's employers added 171,000 positions in October, according to just-published data from the US Labor Department.)

Message.Title: Samsung will strangle Apple
Message.Msg: Samsung nearly triples global tablet market share in 3Q2012:IDC GLOBAL - Although Apple retains its position as the world's top tablet vendor, Samsung increased tablet shipments by over 300 per cent, growing its market share from 6.4 per cent in 3Q2011 to 18.4 per cent in the same quarter this year. Smartphone sales up 47 percent as Android increases its lead Gartner figures show that while smartphone sales are up by almost half, some smartphone makers continue to flourish (think Samsung) while others are struggling (ouch, Nokia).
